snippet: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta is set to present a strategy for $450 billion in cuts over the next 10 years — and an outline of a carefully shrunk military.
abstract: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta is set this week to reveal a strategy that will guide the Pentagon in cutting hundreds of billions of dollars from its budget; Panetta is expected to outline plans for carefully shrinking the military, and in so doing make it clear that the Pentagon will no longer maintain the ability to fight two sustained ground wars at once.

byline.original: By ELISABETH BUMILLER and THOM SHANKER

lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta is set to present a strategy for $450 billion in cuts over the next 10 years — and an outline of a carefully shrunk military.

headline.seo: Pentagon to Present Vision of Reduced Military
headline.main: Panetta to Offer Strategy for Cutting Military Budget
headline.print_headline: Panetta to Offer Budget Strategy Cutting Military

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
